housing_price package

Submodules

housing_price.ingest_data module

This module contains helper functions for ingestion of data. Running this standalone downloads the housing data and stores preprocessed copies of it in the specified folders.

housing_price.ingest_data.fetch_housing_data(housing_url: str, housing_path: str) → None

Function to download and extract housing data.

housing_urlstr

Url to download the housing data from.

housing_pathstr

Path to store the raw csv files after extraction.

housing_price.ingest_data.parse_args() → argparse.Namespace

Commandline argument parser for standalone run.

arparse.Namespace
Commandline arguments. Contains keys: [“raw”: str,

“processed”: str, “log_level”: str, “no_console_log”: bool, “log_path”: str]

housing_price.ingest_data.pre_process_data(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, imputer: Optional[sklearn.impute._base.SimpleImputer] = None) → tuple[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, sklearn.impute._base.SimpleImputer]

Preprocesses the given dataframe. Imputes missing values with median. Replaces categorical column “ocean_proximity” with onehot dummy variables.

dfpd.DataFrame

Dataframe to preprocess.

imputerSimpleImputer, optional

Imputer that imputes missing values, by default None. If None, new imputer is created and fit to the given dataframe.

tuple[pd.DataFrame, SimpleImputer]

Index 0 is the preprocessed dataframe. Index 1 is the SimpleImputer passed or fit on the dataframe if None is passed.

housing_price.ingest_data.run(args: argparse.Namespace, logger: logging.Logger) → None

Does all the ingesting work (fetching, splitting, preprocessing). Gets called if this module is run standalone.

argsNamespace

Commandline arguments from parse_args.

loggerLogger

Logger to log the state while running.

housing_price.ingest_data.stratified_shuffle_split(base_df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → tuple[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, pandas.core.frame.DataFrame]

Does stratified shuffle split on “income_cat” attribute of housing data.

base_dfpd.DataFrame

The dataframe to be split.

tuple[pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame]

[train_dataset, test_dataset]

housing_price.logger module

housing_price.logger.configure_logger(logger=None, cfg=None, log_file=None, console=True, log_level='DEBUG')

Function to setup configurations of logger through function.

The individual arguments of log_file, console, log_level will overwrite the ones in cfg.

logger:

Predefined logger object if present. If None a ew logger object will be created from root.

cfg: dict()

Configuration of the logging to be implemented by default

log_file: str

Path to the log file for logs to be stored

console: bool

To include a console handler(logs printing in console)

log_level: str

One of [“INFO”,”DEBUG”,”WARNING”,”ERROR”,”CRITICAL”] default - “DEBUG”

logging.Logger

housing_price.score module

This module contains helper functions to score the models. Can be run standalone with commandline arguments for models and the datasets to score them on.

housing_price.score.load_data(path: str) → tuple[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, pandas.core.series.Series]

Loads dataset and splits features and labels.

pathstr

Path to training dataset csv file.

tuple[pd.DataFrame, pd.Series]

Index 0 is the testing features dataframe. Index 1 is the testing labels series.

housing_price.score.load_models(path: str) → list[sklearn.base.BaseEstimator]

Loads models from given directory path.

pathstr

Path to directory with model pkl files.

list[sklearn.base.BaseEstimator]

List of models loaded from pkl files in directory.

housing_price.score.parse_args() → argparse.Namespace

Commandline argument parser for standalone run.

arparse.Namespace
Commandline arguments. Contains keys: [“models”: str,

“dataset”: str, “rmse”: bool, “mae”: bool, “log_level”: str, “no_console_log”: bool, “log_path”: str]

housing_price.score.run(args: argparse.Namespace, logger: logging.Logger) → None

Runs the whole scoring process according to the given commandline arguments.

argsNamespace

Commandline arguments from parse_args.

loggerLogger

Logs the outputs.

housing_price.score.score_model(model: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, X: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, y: pandas.core.series.Series, args: argparse.Namespace) → dict

Scores given model on given data.

modelsklearn.base.BaseEstimator

Estimator to score.

Xpd.DataFrame

Input features dataframe.

ypd.Series

Ground truth labels.

argsNamespace

Command line arguments. Used to determine which scores to calculate.

dict

Contains calculated scores.

housing_price.train module

This module contains helper functions to train models. Can be run standalone with commandline arguments for dataset path and models directory.

housing_price.train.load_data(path: str) → tuple[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, pandas.core.series.Series]

Loads dataset and splits features and labels.

pathstr

Path to training dataset csv file.

tuple[pd.DataFrame, pd.Series]

Index 0 is the training features dataframe. Index 1 is the training labels series.

housing_price.train.parse_args() → argparse.Namespace

Commandline argument parser for standalone run.

arparse.Namespace
Commandline arguments. Contains keys: [“models”: str,

“dataset”: str, “log_level”: str, “no_console_log”: bool, “log_path”: str]

housing_price.train.run(args: argparse.Namespace, logger: logging.Logger) → None

Runs the whole training process according to given commandline arguments.

argsNamespace

Commandline arguments from parse_args.

loggerLogger

Logs the outputs.

housing_price.train.save_model(model: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, dir: str) → tuple[str, str]

Saves the given model in given directory as pickle file.

modelsklearn.base.BaseEstimator

Estimator to save.

dirstr

Directory to save in.

tuple[str, str]

Index 0 is the name of the model. Index 1 is the path it is saved in.
